text: I've been maybe barking up the wrong tree here anyway :sweat_smile:  needs more logging & testing

Hey, I we are using GitHub to log into the product, but we cannot see any analytics - where they came from. We can see that logging in with Gmail works. We have HubSpot api in the form and collective forms on.  Has anyone else come across this issue? Does anyone have a solution? Happy tp give more info. Thanks.
how do I find out my association types?

Hello!  Long time lurker...  I'm not a developer, however I'm being tasked with setting up a connector between Boomi and HubSpot.  It _should_ be easy?  But I'm having trouble with figuring out how to set it up.  Does anyone have any experience with setting up these connectors and can point me in the right direction?
Hey guys, is there a way to get the data points of the knowledge base articles via API? Like who created the article, created date, updated date, etc. Thank you for your help :grin:

With Python I get them using the v3 API, check out this notes to tickets example:
```import requests
import json

url = "<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/associations/note/ticket/types>"

querystring = {"hapikey":"XXXX"}

headers = {'accept': "application/json",
            'content-type': "application/json" }


response = requests.get(url=url, headers=headers, params=querystring)

x = json.loads(response.text)
print(x)```
thanks I ended up just using postman

Is there a way to use *`/crm/v3/objects/notes/search`*
to just return notes with attachments?

We have an app that was working fine until yesterday. Since this morning we have stopped receiving requests from HubSpot. The CRM card’s Data Fetch URL is never called. I am wondering if anyone else is facing this issue?
Hey <@U02CCSA4G9H> there was an <https://status.HubSpot.com/incidents/bwg0btvhhg2y|issue> on HubSpot's end but it's now been resolved
Yes that was it. Thanks Zack!

<@UD53A9UUR> the developers liked this solution said thank you-they had a question: For the json sent do they need to send/write time stamp in or does HubSpot auto know the historical date for us to be able to sort with what was sent?
Not 100% sure what they mean, but the JSON response will include a timestamp
Yes I confirm that  the HubSpot tracking script is on the external site. The name property is all in lowercase (i replaced it in the code with some random text).
